thread.title: Heavy snowload causes Hanwell business's roof to collapse
thread.title_full: Heavy snowload causes Hanwell business's roof to collapse

author: cbc
title: Heavy snowload causes Hanwell business's roof to collapse
text:
No one was injured after heavy snow caused a section of a roof to collapse on a business in Hanwell, N.B., Saturday morning.
Upper Kingsclear Fire Department Chief Murray Crouse said they responded to the call at Signature Sounds after those in the building were worried someone might be trapped.
Crouse said people were inside the building getting ready to set up equipment when they heard cracking.
"When they looked into the bay, the roof was sagged down and setting on the racks," he said.
Crouse said firefighters made sure there was no one inside.
"The walls were sagged out at the far end where the roof had collapsed and basically, no one is in danger," he said.
The fire chief said the business was going to bring in engineers to determine how to stabilize the building so they could get the roof cleaned off and get their equipment out.
The Upper Kingsclear Fire Department tweeted out a warning for others to keep their roofs cleared of snow.
Responded to a #roofcollapse due to heavy snow on #hanwell Please keep your roof clean!
â€” @UKFD More snow is on the way for New Brunswick Sunday, with more expected in the southern part of the province.
Crouse said many homes and businesses do their best to clean the snow off of roofs, but depending on things like the direction of the wind, snow can get stuck on certain sections.
Fire marshal warns homeowners to clear vents and roofs
